pr_title: use UUID as the name of model directory

timeline.message: use UUID as the name of model directory
Name the model file with UUID

timeline.bodyText: NIT: log message is not descriptive. We should probably add the model name to go along with the etag
timeline.author: maaquib

replies.bodyText:
./torchserve_sanity.sh | grep --line-buffered eTag
+ source scripts/install_utils
++ set -euo pipefail
+ set +u
+ install_torch_deps
+ '[' is_gpu_instance ']'
+ '[' '' == cuda101 ']'
+ pip install -U -r requirements.txt
+ set -u
+ install_pytest_suite_deps
+ pip install -U -r requirements/developer.txt
+ install_bert_dependencies
+ pip install transformers
+ run_backend_pytest
+ python -m pytest --cov-report html:htmlcov --cov=ts/ ts/tests/unit_tests/
+ echo 'Backend test suite execution successful'
+ build_frontend
+ frontend/gradlew -p frontend clean build

replies.bodyText:
NIT: log message is not descriptive. We should probably add the model name to go along with the etag

model name doesn't passed to function ModelArchive.unzip() nor function ModelArchive.downloadModel(String modelStore, String url), so add the model name to go along with the etag need to change all the functions that us them. And use UUID is an easier and better way to distinguish these files.
When I run frontend/gradlew.bat -p frontend clean build on Windows 10, there are 3 test cases using the same eTag 29385dfc880480adb4ff8a26d9461d72539fb887, here is the log https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/sBjJmnWDSv/
replies.author: MengMeng96
